summary: Use of waste in construction
description: Use of waste in construction using suitable waste rather than virgin raw material or material which has ceased to be waste - for example by complying with a Quality Protocol.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to use suitable waste rather than virgin raw material or material which has ceased to be waste - for example by complying with a Quality Protocol.

summary: Use of baled end-of-life tyres in construction
description: Using a small number of end-of-life tyre bales in construction.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to use a small number of end-of-life tyre bales in construction.

summary: Construction of entertainment or educational installations
description: Groups such as schools, colleges and theatres using waste such as off-cuts of wood creatively.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows groups such as schools, colleges and theatres to use waste such as off-cuts of wood creatively.

summary: Burning of waste as a fuel in a small appliance
description: Using waste as fuel to produce heat or power.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to use waste as fuel to produce heat or power.

summary: Using biodiesel produced from waste as fuel
description: Storing and using biodiesel produced from waste as fuel in portable generators and motor vehicles.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to store and use biodiesel produced from waste as fuel in portable generators and motor vehicles.

summary: Using sludge to re-seed a waste water treatment plant
description: Importing sludge from another waste water treatment plant to re-seed the biological process at a waste water treatment plant.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to import sludge from another waste water treatment plant to re-seed the biological process at a waste water treatment plant.

summary: Using effluent to clean a highway gravel bed
description: Using effluent from water and waste treatment plants to clean highway gravel beds. This reduces the amount of tap water used where high quality water is not needed.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to use effluent from water and waste treatment plants to clean highway gravel beds. This reduces the amount of tap water used where high quality water is not needed.

summary: Using waste for a specified purpose
description: Using waste that does not need treating, to reduce the use of virgin or non waste materials.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to use waste that does not need treating, to reduce the use of virgin or non waste materials.

summary: Using waste to manufacture finished goods
description: Using waste in place of raw materials to manufacture a finished product.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to use waste in place of raw materials to manufacture a finished product.

summary: Spreading waste to benefit agricultural land
description: Spreading specific waste on agricultural land to replace manufactured fertilisers or virgin materials such as agricultural lime used to improve or maintain soil.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to spread specific waste on agricultural land to replace manufactured fertilisers or virgin materials such as agricultural lime used to improve or maintain soil.

summary: Spreading waste to benefit non-agricultural land
description: Spreading different waste on non-agricultural land to replace manufactured fertilisers or virgin materials such as agricultural lime used to improve or maintain soil.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to spread different waste on non-agricultural land to replace manufactured fertilisers or virgin materials such as agricultural lime used to improve or maintain soil.

summary: Using mulch
description: Landscapers, farmers or growers spreading mulch as a protective covering onto land around trees, bushes or plants.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows landscapers and farmers or growers to spread mulch as a protective covering onto land around trees, bushes or plants.

summary: Spreading plant matter to provide benefits
description: Spreading cut plants at the place of production for weed suppression or to provide nutrients to the soil.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to spread cut plants at the place of production for weed suppression or to provide nutrients to the soil.

summary: Incorporating ash into soil
description: Mixing ash back into the soil to return some of the nutrients from burnt crops and vegetation.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to mix ash back into the soil to return some of the nutrients from the burnt crops and vegetation back to the soil.

summary: Spreading of pig and poultry ash
description: Mixing ash from burning pig or poultry carcasses with slurry and/or manure and spreading it on farmland to provide the soil with nutrients.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to mix ash from burning pig or poultry carcasses with slurry and/or manure and spread it on farmland to provide the soil with nutrients.

summary: Using depolluted end-of-life vehicles for parts
description: Reusing parts from depolluted end-of-life vehicles in other vehicles.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows the parts from depolluted end-of-life vehicles to be re-used in other vehicles.

summary: Cleaning, washing, spraying or coating relevant waste
description: Treating waste packaging so that it can be reused in its original form. Also cleaning suitable waste to allow it to be recycled.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat waste packaging so that it can be reused in its original form. You can also clean suitable waste to allow it to be recycled.

summary: Recovering textiles
description: Cleaning waste clothes and textiles to recover them so they can be reused or recycled.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to clean waste clothes and textiles to recover them so they can be reused or recycled.

summary: Preparatory treatments (baling, sorting, shredding etc)
description: Treating waste to reduce its volume to help transport it to another site for reuse or recycling or make handling easier.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat waste to reduce its volume to help transport it to another site for reuse or recycling or make handling easier.

summary: Screening and blending waste
description: Temporarily treating waste on a small scale to produce aggregate or soil at a place such as a construction or demolition site.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to temporarily treat waste on a small scale to produce aggregate or soil at a place such as a construction or demolition site.

summary: Treating waste wood and waste plant matter by chipping, shredding, cutting or pulverising
description: Chipping, shredding, cutting or pulverising waste wood and waste plant matter to make it easier to store and transport, or converting it into a suitable form to use. The waste treated by these methods must be suitable for its intended use, which can include feedstock for producing products such as panel board, mulch, surfacing tracks (paths and bridleways) or fuel.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to chip, shred, cut or pulverise waste wood and waste plant matter to make it easier to store and transport, or to convert it into a suitable form to use. The waste treated by these methods must be suitable for its intended use, which can include feedstock for producing products such as panel board, mulch, surfacing tracks (paths and bridleways) or fuel.

summary: Mechanically treating end-of-life tyres
description: Treating small amounts of waste end-of-life tyres by baling, shredding, peeling, shaving or granulating so they can be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat small amounts of waste end-of-life tyres by baling, shredding, peeling, shaving or granulating so they can be recovered.

summary: Recovering scrap metal
description: Treating scrap metal by sorting, grading, shearing by manual feed, baling, crushing or cutting it with hand-held equipment to make it easier to handle and to help recover it.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat scrap metal by sorting, grading, shearing by manual feed, baling, crushing or cutting it with hand-held equipment to make it easier to handle and to help recover it.

summary: Sorting mixed waste
description: Small organisations, such as charities, separating recyclable waste so that it can be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows small organisations, such as charities to sort out separate recyclable waste so that it can be recovered.

summary: Manually treating waste
description: Sorting, repairing or refurbishing waste to reuse it, or sorting and dismantling it so it can be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to sort, repair or refurbish waste to reuse it, or to sort and dismantle it so it can be recovered.

summary: Treating waste food
description: Recovering waste food by decanting or unwrapping it and recovering the packaging.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to recover waste food by decanting or unwrapping it and recovering the packaging.

summary: Crushing and emptying vehicle waste oil filters
description: Recovering oil from oil filters, then crushing them so they can be transported and recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to recover oil from oil filters, then crush them so they can be transported to be recovered.

summary: Treating waste aerosol cans
description: Treating aerosol cans by puncturing or crushing them using specialist treatment equipment so that the metal can be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat aerosol cans by puncturing or crushing them using specialist treatment equipment so that the metal can be recovered.

summary: Treating waste toner and ink cartridges
description: Treating waste toner or ink cartridges by sorting, cleaning, dismantling or refilling them.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat waste toner or ink cartridges by sorting, cleaning, dismantling or refilling them.

summary: Crushing waste fluorescent tubes
description: Treating waste fluorescent tubes before collection for recovery.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat waste fluorescent tubes before collection for recovery.

summary: Using flocculants to remove water from waste
description: Treating waste by using flocculants to remove water from the waste so that clay or water-based paints can be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat waste by using flocculants to remove water from the waste so that clay or water-based paints can be recovered.

summary: Physical and chemical treatment of waste edible oil and fat to produce biodiesel
description: Small-scale physical and chemical treatment of waste edible oils and fat to produce fuel.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows the small-scale physical and chemical treatment of waste edible oils and fat to produce fuel.

summary: Treating waste at a water treatment works
description: Treating certain waste at a water treatment works to reduce the volume for transport, or making it easier to handle before the waste is recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat certain waste at a water treatment works to reduce the volume for transport or to make it easier to handle before the waste is recovered.

summary: Recovery of waste at a waste water treatment works
description: Recovering waste, such as sludge from a septic tank or cesspool, which needs further treatment at a waste water treatment works.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to recover waste, such as sludge from a septic tank or cesspool, which needs further treatment at a waste water treatment works.

summary: Aerobic composting and associated prior treatment
description: Composting small volumes of vegetation, cardboard and food waste to produce compost that can be spread to benefit the land by adding nutrients or improving the structure of the soil. Also treating the waste, before you compost it, by chipping or similar activities.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to compost small volumes of vegetation, cardboard and food waste to produce compost that can be spread to benefit the land by adding nutrients or improving the structure of the soil. You can also treat the waste, before you compost it, by chipping or similar activities.

summary: Anaerobic digestion at premises used for agriculture and burning resulting biogas
description: Farmers anaerobically digesting manure, slurry and vegetation on their farms to produce digestate that can be used as a fertiliser or soil conditioner. The anaerobic digestion (AD) process also produces biogas, which can be burnt to generate energy, for use on the farm, or exported to the National Grid.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows farmers to anaerobically digest manure, slurry and vegetation on their farms to produce digestate that can be used as a fertiliser or soil conditioner. The anaerobic digestion (AD) process also produces biogas, which can be burnt to generate energy, either to use on the farm or to export to the National Grid.

summary: Anaerobic digestion at premises not used for agriculture and burning resulting biogas
description: Treating food and other biodegradable waste by anaerobic digestion to produce a digestate, which can be used to benefit land. The gas produced (biogas) must be used for generating energy.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat food and other biodegradable waste by anaerobic digestion to produce a digestate, which can be used to benefit land. The gas produced (biogas) must be used for generating energy.

summary: Treatment of kitchen waste in a wormery
description: Very small-scale treatment of waste from kitchens using a wormery to produce compost. The compost can be spread on land to add nutrients or to improve the structure of the soil.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows very small-scale treatment of waste from kitchens using a wormery to produce compost. The compost can be spread on land to add nutrients or to improve the structure of the soil.

summary: Treatment of sheep dip using organophosphate-degrading enzyme
description: Treating organophosphate sheep dip with an approved organophosphate degrading enzyme.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows organophosphate sheep dip to be treated with an approved organophosphate degrading enzyme.

summary: Sort and denature controlled drugs for disposal
description: Pharmacies and other similar places complying with the requirements of the Misuse of Drugs Regulations 2001 by denaturing controlled drugs (making them unsuitable for consumption).
guidance-desc: This exemption allows pharmacies and other similar places to comply with the requirements of the Misuse of Drugs Regulations 2001 by denaturing controlled drugs (making them unsuitable for consumption).

summary: Treatment of non-hazardous pesticide washings by carbon filtration for disposal
description: Treating non-hazardous pesticide washings before disposing of them to land. Pesticide washings treated this way are less likely to damage the environment when discharged to land compared to untreated pesticide washings.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat non-hazardous pesticide washings before disposing of them to land. Pesticide washings treated this way are less likely to damage the environment when discharged to land compared to untreated pesticide washings.

summary: Recovery of silver
description: Recovering silver from waste produced in connection with printing or photographic processes.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to recover silver from waste produced in connection with printing or photographic processes.

summary: Recovery of monopropylene glycol from aircraft antifreeze fluids
description: Airports treating waste antifreeze to recover monopropylene glycol.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows airports to treat waste antifreeze to recover monopropylene glycol.

summary: Treatment of waste in a biobed or biofilter
description: Treating non-hazardous pesticide washings in a biobed or biofilter. The treated washings can be re-used and the biobed material (biomix) can then be spread on land (under an exemption) for agricultural or ecological benefit.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to treat non-hazardous pesticide washings in a biobed or biofilter. The treated washings can be re-used and the biobed material (biomix) can then be spread on land (under an exemption) for agricultural or ecological benefit.

summary: Recovery of central heating oil by filtration
description: Filtering central heating oil so that it can be reused.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to filter central heating oil so that it can be reused.

summary: Depositing waste from dredging inland waters
description: Depositing dredging spoil (dredgings) on the banks of the waters it was dredged from and treating it by screening and removing water.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to deposit dredging spoil (dredgings) on the banks of the waters it was dredged from and to treat it by screening and removing water.

summary: Depositing waste from a railway sanitary convenience
description: Where older rolling stock, for example parts of a vintage steam train, has not or cannot be fitted with appropriate collection facilities, this exemption allows it to deposit sanitary waste onto tracks.
guidance-desc: Some older rolling stock, for example forming part of a vintage steam train, has not been or cannot be fitted with appropriate collection facilities. This exemption allows this rolling stock to deposit sanitary waste onto the track.

summary: Depositing waste from a portable sanitary convenience
description: Burying waste from a portable toilet to avoid small quantities having to be transported long distances to sewage treatment works.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to bury waste from a portable toilet to avoid small quantities having to be transported long distances to sewage treatment works.

summary: Depositing agricultural waste consisting of plant tissue under a Plant Health Notice
description: Depositing diseased crops where they were grown, when a Plant Health Notice has been issued. This is to reduce the risk of spreading plant diseases or pests.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to deposit diseased crops, where they were grown, when a Plant Health Notice has been issued. This is to reduce the risk of spreading plant diseases or pests.

summary: Depositing waste samples for testing or analysis
description: Depositing and storing waste samples, where they are required to comply with or enforce specified regulations, or before testing and analysis for research.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to deposit and store waste samples, where these are required to comply with or enforce specified regulations, or before testing and analysis for research.

summary: Disposal by incineration
description: Disposing of small amounts of specific waste that have been produced on your site, in an incinerator.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to dispose of small amounts of specific waste that have been produced on your site, in an incinerator.

summary: Burning waste in the open
description: Burning plant tissue and untreated wood waste from joinery or manufacturing in the open air.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to burn plant tissue and untreated wood waste from joinery or manufacturing in the open air.

summary: Burning waste at a port under a Plant Health Notice
description: Burning plant tissue waste and wood packaging and packing material waste, at a port, when a Plant Health Notice has been served to prevent the spread of plant diseases.
guidance-desc: This exemption only allows you to burn plant tissue waste and wood packaging and packing material waste, at a port, when a Plant Health Notice has been served to prevent the spread of plant diseases.

summary: Storing waste in secure containers
description: Storing specific waste in secure containers at a different place to where the waste was produced, before it's transported to another site to be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to store specific waste in secure containers at a different place to where the waste was produced, before the waste is transported to another site to be recovered.

summary: Storing waste in a secure place
description: Storing specific waste at a secure place that's different to where it was produced, before the waste is transported to another site to be recovered.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to store specific waste at a secure place that is different to where the waste was produced, before the waste is transported to another site to be recovered.

summary: Storing sludge
description: Storing sewage sludge at a place where it's to be used in accordance with the Sludge (Use in Agriculture) Regulations 1989.
guidance-desc: This exemption allows you to store sewage sludge at a place where it's to be used in accordance with the Sludge (Use in Agriculture) Regulations 1989.
